pages.title: CV Protocol Changes

content.text: Protocol proposals are used to drive changes in a product controlled by the community, especially on-chain products. These changes can be large or small. For small and low-risk changes, including inflation rate and yield rate adjustments, a lightweight proposal can be used. Additional rigor and communications will be required for high-risk changes such as major product updates. Major changes often are accompanied by audits.
Provide a clear and comprehensive explanation of the change. Include the rationales.
Provide details of the change and implementations
Outline likely risk items and what might go wrong.
Provide the name and info of the auditor, the code that was audited, and the results

pages.contentText: Protocol proposals are used to drive changes in a product controlled by the community, especially on-chain products. These changes can be large or small. For small and low-risk changes, including inflation rate and yield rate adjustments, a lightweight proposal can be used. Additional rigor and communications will be required for high-risk changes such as major product updates. Major changes often are accompanied by audits.SummaryProvide a clear and comprehensive explanation of the change. Include the rationales.SpecificationProvide details of the change and implementationsKnown RiskOutline likely risk items and what might go wrong.AuditsProvide the name and info of the auditor, the code that was audited, and the results

pages.title: CV Investments

content.text: A defining hallmark of investment proposals is that the community trades treasury assets for another asset it anticipates to increase in value. Examples can be on-chain (tokens, vesting tokens, NFTs, staked tokens) and off-chain (any traditional world asset). Investments can be purely market-driven or also strategically driven. Strategic decisions can be caused by partner incentive alignment, meta-governance, or M&A.
Amount of the request. A high-level breakdown of the amount in percentage spend. Represent amounts in DAO tokens and fiat
Describe the unmet community or customer needs and their size
Provide the structure of the deal. Include the type and amount of assets being exchanged. Also, pro
vide the methodologies used to value the assets.
Detail description of the funding uses

Depending on the location(s) of the deals, this could be a very long and complicated section. Provide all considerations to ensure that the arrangements are within the legal and compliance frameworks of the local government(s).

pages.title: CharmVerse

content.text: The solution for token communities to build relationships, work together and vote. Manage members, coordinate tasks, facilitate structured discussions & decisions, and hold each other accountable.
What are you going to build?
Grant submission, voting and post-grant tracking

pages.title: CV Metagov Changes

content.text: Test CHANGE to check view sync

Sometimes a community needs to change its governance, e.g., migrating from  Governor Alpha to Governor Bravo. Typically these meta-governance proposals take the form of contract migrations, but they can also involve the creation of subgroup structures. Additionally, they can involve
off-chain governance structures, such as moving governance forums, adopting off-chain voting methods, etc.
Describe the rationales behind the governance structure change proposed. Include reasons for why now.
challenges that are prompting the change
Provide the details of the proposed system. Describe the pros and cons of such a system.
Expand on the steps required for this change.

pages.contentText: Test CHANGE to check view syncSometimes a community needs to change its governance, e.g., migrating from  Governor Alpha to Governor Bravo. Typically these meta-governance proposals take the form of contract migrations, but they can also involve the creation of subgroup structures. Additionally, they can involve using off-chain governance structures, such as moving governance forums, adopting off-chain voting methods, etc.SummaryProvide a 1-paragraph summary of the change and its rationalesMotivationDescribe the rationales behind the governance structure change proposed. Include reasons for why now.Previous Governance StructureDescribe the current governance structure and the challenges that are prompting the changeProposed ChangesProvide the details of the proposed system. Describe the pros and cons of such a system. Implementation DetailsExpand on the steps required for this change. Next StepsAssuming positive reception, what happens?

pages.title: Grants

content.text: Grants usually fund one-off initiatives perceived as creating value for the community. Examples include product/protocol modules, code reviews, relevant research, bd/growth initiatives, and ecosystem support initiatives. When the grant amount or delivery duration is significant, proposals can include milestones and quantitative metrics on what constitutes successful delivery. When the initiative benefits multiple communities, disclosing other funding applications can serve as a positive social signal.
A 1-paragraph summary of the Grants proposal. It should
describe the fund usage and include
Provide context of the proposal. Describe the current challenges, history, and stakeholders involved.
Provide context for Why and Why Now?
Provide a high-level schedule of implementation. If complexity demands it, provide detailed schedule and execution plans.
Provide the cost of the grants and frequency of deployment

pages.contentText: Grants usually fund one-off initiatives perceived as creating value for the community. Examples include product/protocol modules, code reviews, relevant research, bd/growth initiatives, and ecosystem support initiatives. When the grant amount or delivery duration is significant, proposals can include milestones and quantitative metrics on what constitutes successful delivery. When the initiative benefits multiple communities, disclosing other funding applications can serve as a positive social signal.SUMMARYA 1-paragraph summary of the Grants proposal. It should describe the fund usage and include a high-level budget. MOTIVATIONProvide context of the proposal. Describe the current challenges, history, and stakeholders involved. RATIONALEProvide context for Why and Why Now?IMPLEMENTATIONProvide high-level execution stepsTIMELINEProvide a high-level schedule of implementation. If complexity demands it, provide detailed schedule and execution plans.COSTProvide the cost of the grants and frequency of deployment

pages.title: Budget

content.text: Budgets usually fund continuous workstreams and value-creating initiatives. Examples include product/protocol development, growth, and operations. Workstream funding proposals are typically bound to specific timeframes (e.g., seasons, quarters) and have well-articulated qualitative and quantitative deliverables. Often the teams performing specific workstreams remain consistent across timeframes.
level breakdown of the amount in percentage spend. Represent amounts in DAO tokens and fiat
Provide major milestones expected to achieve based on

or a third-party service. Often these delegates are investors, early contributors, college blockchain clubs, or professional service organizations.

content.text: to help streamline and enhance the efficiency and consistency of the application process for
population of enthusiastic and talented value-aligned builders

Attract exceptional community members into the Grants program, individuals who share our goals and mission. This, in turn, will draw the most dedicated contributors to enrich the ecosystem.

children.contentText: The Grants Council's role is to help streamline and enhance the efficiency and consistency of the application process for grant proposers.MissionThe Grants Program's mission is to:Grow the population of enthusiastic and talented value-aligned builders in the ecosystem. The Grants program should support developers launching novel applications that will draw new users and maintain our long-term growth.Attract exceptional community members into the Grants program, individuals who share our goals and mission. This, in turn, will draw the most dedicated contributors to enrich the ecosystem.Grants Council responsibilities:Develop a more streamlined and consistent process, with structure and standard operating procedure for reviewing grants, and perform interviews, where appropriate, with grant applicants.Streamline the process and manage payments for approved proposals.Collaborate with proposers to ensure that proposed project milestones are clearly defined, measurable, and achievable within the specified timeframe.Provide post-grant support to project teams by facilitating connections with core contributors to offer the right support and marketing efforts.StructureThe Grants Council consists of four members responsible for reviewing proposals across all funding categories.[List Council members here and provide contact info]Member 1, Title, ContactMember 2, Title, ContactAdditional detailsIn future iterations, the intention is for additional community members will be empowered to join the Grants Council through community-based elections.

children.contentText: Approval ProcessPhase 1 (Filtering): Applications submitted on CharmVerse will be reviewed and discussed by the Grants Council. Phase 2 (Refinement): Within 7 days of receiving the application, the Grants Council will provide feedback to proposers and follow-up with questions and/or request a call.  Applicants will have the opportunity to incorporate feedback from the Grants Council to refine their grant applications. Phase 3 (Final Decision): At the end of the application window, the Grants Council will review and discuss refined proposals on a Weekly Sync. The Grants Council will carry out an internal vote to approve/reject each application. The Grants Council's final decision will be publicly announced, and approved applications can now get to work on their project!During the review period, if one of the Grants Council members believes that a certain proposal may benefit from wider community approval, the Grants Council may seek community consensus via  Snapshot vote. Grantee Milestones and GuidelinesInitial grant proposals should prioritize milestones achievable within a 2-3 month timeframe.As part of their application, each grant proposer is expected to assess how their project's roadmap aligns with and enhances the ecosystem.Grant applicants are required to outline a set of milestones by which the Community and the Grants Council can judge the progress of the proposer’s project.As part of their application, each grant proposer is expected to describe the expected timeline for overall grant completion.Milestones are critical in establishing consensus between the grant proposer, the Grants Council, and the community. They serve as specific benchmarks that showcase genuine commitment to achieving the proposed project objectives.The Grants Council will collaborate directly with successful grant proposers to define milestones that will determine the overall success of each project.Each successful proposer must establish completion of each milestone deliverable within the defined grant scope.Milestone payments will be disbursed upon the successful completion of each milestone.Payment AdministrationCurrency: All transactions are done in USDC.Administration: Handled by the Grants Council via the Grants Program multisig.Milestone-based Payments: Payments are released upon milestone completion.

children.title: Request for Grants

content.text: The mission of the Grants Program is to increase the adoption of long-term contributors and developers building novel applications.
represent specific challenges and needs that we are actively looking to fund. This approach will ensure that G
allocates grants to projects that align
Contributors can apply to receive between $5k to $50k of funding per grant for any of the categories.
Support the development of tools that simplify and enhance the experience for developers building in our ecosystem.
Tools that improve the developer experience building on our framework
Frameworks that make it easy to develop applications on our framework
Testing and debugging frameworks that help developers to test and debug their applications.
Monitoring and analytics tools that help developers to monitor and analyze the performance of their applications.
Promote the development of games that encourage growth and onboarding on

Infrastructure and tooling that simplifies game development on
Open-source games that can be reused/built upon by other developers.

The Grants Council will use the Rubric below to grade proposals during Phase 1 of the application filtering process. To arrive at a final decision, the Grants Council will evaluate each proposal and come to a consensus through an internal vote.
[Share your rubric with the community here. You could add an image or modify the table below]
Team expertise, domain alignment, technical understanding + critical skills
Likelihood the project has immediate/long-term chances of success and can generate value
Grant size is proportional to the benefit or expected outcome
Whether milestones hold grantees accountable + if they are trackable
Novel use of technology used or is it copy paste
Whether the project has some tangible use of web3 technology and would lead to broad adoption of web3 technology

children.contentText: Wave 1 Mission and AllotmentThe mission of the Grants Program is to increase the adoption of long-term contributors and developers building novel applications.For Wave 1, the Grants Council has allotted up to $500k in USDC, to be distributed across 4 areas of focus that represent specific challenges and needs that we are actively looking to fund. This approach will ensure that Grants Program allocates grants to projects that align with the ecosystem's priorities.Areas of FocusContributors can apply to receive between $5k to $50k of funding per grant for any of the categories. 1️⃣  Decentralized ApplicationsTotal Allocation: $150,000Objective: Fund projects that leverage our frameworks to create innovative dApps valuable to the broader ecosystem.Expected Deliverables: Creation and deployment of dApps.2️⃣  IntegrationsTotal Allocation: $100,000Objective: Fund solutions that integrate our technology with other innovative technologies.Expected Deliverables: Projects that integrate our technology with other innovative technologies.3️⃣  Developer ToolingTotal Allocation: $100,000Objective: Support the development of tools that simplify and enhance the experience for developers building in our ecosystem.Expected Deliverables:Tools that improve the developer experience building on our frameworkFrameworks that make it easy to develop applications on our frameworkTesting and debugging frameworks that help developers to test and debug their applications.Monitoring and analytics tools that help developers to monitor and analyze the performance of their applications.4️⃣  GamingTotal Allocation: $150,000Objective: Promote the development of games that encourage growth and onboarding on our chain. Expected Deliverables:Games that highlight the capabilities of our tech.Infrastructure and tooling that simplifies game development on our framework.Open-source games that can be reused/built upon by other developers.Evaluation RubricThe Grants Council will use the Rubric below to grade proposals during Phase 1 of the application filtering process. To arrive at a final decision, the Grants Council will evaluate each proposal and come to a consensus through an internal vote. [Share your rubric with the community here. You could add an image or modify the table below]ScoreDescription12345TeamTeam expertise, domain alignment, technical understanding + critical skillsLikelihood of successLikelihood the project has immediate/long-term chances of success and can generate value for the ecosystemGrant sizeGrant size is proportional to the benefit or expected outcomeMilestone assessmentWhether milestones hold grantees accountable + if they are trackableExperimentation + NoveltyNovel use of technology used or is it copy pasteTangible Usecase for Web3 TechnologyWhether the project has some tangible use of web3 technology and would lead to broad adoption of web3 technologyCartesi RelationshipWhether the project is exclusively committed to our smart contractsDemo included (binary yes/no)No demo/poor demo vs high-quality demo includedDiscretionally factors (comments required)Application FormThis application form is included here for reference but applications should be created and submitted here: Section 1: Basic DetailsWhat grant type are you applying for?Decentralized Applications IntegrationsDeveloper ToolingGamingProject name:Author name and contact information:ERC-20 Payee address (to receive grant):What is the size of your grant request?How do you justify the size of the request?I understand that I will be expected to provide follow-up grant reporting information to the Grants Council and Cartesi Forum.YesNoSection 2: Project detailsIn a sentence, what are you going to build?Please describe in more depth here:Please provide us with any links to any of the following for the project:Link to product demo:Link to website:Link to Github:Link to Twitter:Other:What factors contribute to the potential success of your project?Does your project use any novel technology?What are some competing alternatives to what you are going to build? Is there any previous work you’ll be building on?Will your project be open-source?YesNoSection 3: TeamName and role of team member(s):Link to any previous work the team has contributed to:Tell us about your team’s strengths and qualifications that make you well-suited for this project:Section 4: Roadmap and Milestones:Tell us about your product development journey. Be sure to describe your product development to date (if any).Tell us your implementation plan for your project. Clearly define the milestones you expect to achieve in order to receive milestone-based installments.Milestone 1: [Milestone Name]Deliverables: [List key deliverables for this milestone.]Tasks: [Provide a detailed description of tasks related to this milestone.]Duration: [x weeks/months]Funding Expectation: [$x USD]	Milestone 2: [Milestone Name]Deliverables: [List key deliverables for this milestone.]Tasks: [Provide a detailed description of tasks related to this milestone.]Duration: [x weeks/months]Funding Expectation: [$x USD]What is your estimated timeline for completion of the project?Section 5: RelationshipHow are you planning to build or improve our ecosystem?Try to detail out the plan to leverage our framework and tech.Why will this solution be a source of growth for the ecosystem?Does your project solve a problem for the ecosystem?

children.title: Support + FAQs

content.text: For any assistance and inquiries, please use
[if your program uses Discord, add invite to your discord server here]
[Add link to a CharmVerse Forum category here]
What are the different application stages in the Grants Program?
erse will be reviewed and discussed by the Grants Council.
Within 7 days of receiving the application, the Grants Council will provide feedback
and follow up with questions and/or request a call. Applicants
have the opportunity to incorporate feedback from the Grants
At the end of the application window, the Grants Council
carried out by the Grants Council to approve/reject
The Grant Council's final decision will be publicly announced,
Once the Grants Council vote passes,
can now get to work on their project!
Are startups or new ventures eligible for grants?
Absolutely! As long as the project aligns with
mission and the specified criteria. Projects aiming to be open source or public goods are especially encouraged.
After submitting my proposal, what can I expect?
Your proposal enters a feedback loop where both the community and the Grants Council offer suggestions and insights. It's crucial to be responsive during this phase.
How many grants are typically awarded in each category?
There isn't a fixed number. It's based on the quality and relevance of applications received.
Can I communicate directly with a Grants Council member?
We encourage initial interactions through our community channels.
How should I determine the grant amount to request?
Request what aligns with your project's needs, keeping in mind
mission and the potential impact. Remember to be realistic and justified in your ask.
For the current wave, the Grants Program isn't focused on retroactive grants.
Do I need a specific blockchain address for proposal submission?
For grant payouts, ensure you provide an Ethereum Mainnet-compatible address.
How are the milestones and payouts correlated?
Payments are predominantly milestone-driven. Successful completion of each milestone, as outlined in your proposal, triggers the corresponding payout.
If I encounter issues or need clarity during the application process, what should I do?
Feel free to reach out via the community channels provided above. We're here to guide and assist.

children.contentText: Get in touchFor any assistance and inquiries, please use Discord or Forum.Discord: [if your program uses Discord, add invite to your discord server here]Forum: [Add link to a CharmVerse Forum category here]Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat are the different application stages in the Grants Program?Phase 1 (Filtering): Applications submitted on CharmVerse will be reviewed and discussed by the Grants Council.Phase 2 (Refinement): Within 7 days of receiving the application, the Grants Council will provide feedback to proposers and follow up with questions and/or request a call. Applicants will have the opportunity to incorporate feedback from the Grants Council to refine their grant applications. Phase 3 (Final Decision): At the end of the application window, the Grants Council will review and discuss refined proposals on a CGP Weekly Sync. An internal vote will be carried out by the Grants Council to approve/reject each application. The Grant Council's final decision will be publicly announced, Once the Grants Council vote passes, and approved applications can now get to work on their project! Are startups or new ventures eligible for grants?Absolutely! As long as the project aligns with the mission and the specified criteria. Projects aiming to be open source or public goods are especially encouraged. After submitting my proposal, what can I expect? Your proposal enters a feedback loop where both the community and the Grants Council offer suggestions and insights. It's crucial to be responsive during this phase. How many grants are typically awarded in each category? There isn't a fixed number. It's based on the quality and relevance of applications received. Can I communicate directly with a Grants Council member? We encourage initial interactions through our community channels.How should I determine the grant amount to request? Request what aligns with your project's needs, keeping in mind our mission and the potential impact. Remember to be realistic and justified in your ask. 	Are there retroactive grants? For the current wave, the Grants Program isn't focused on retroactive grants.	Do I need a specific blockchain address for proposal submission? For grant payouts, ensure you provide an Ethereum Mainnet-compatible address.	How are the milestones and payouts correlated? Payments are predominantly milestone-driven. Successful completion of each milestone, as outlined in your proposal, triggers the corresponding payout. 	If I encounter issues or need clarity during the application process, what should I do?Feel free to reach out via the community channels provided above. We're here to guide and assist.
